commission on environmental quality tceq the backflow prevention device must be approved by the american society of sanitary engineers or the foundation for crossconnection control and hydraulic research or the university of southern california or applicable plumbing codes adopted by the city or any other laboratory that has equivalent capabilities for both the laboratory and field evaluation of backflow prevention assemblies as determined by the building official the backflow prevention device must be installed in accordance with the laboratory approved standards or the manufacturers current published recommendations b if conditions exist that present a health hazard one of the following methods must be used to prevent backflow 1 an air gap may be used if a there is an unobstructed physical separation  and b the distance from the lowest point of the water supply outlet to the flood rim of the fixture or assembly into which the outlet discharges is at least one inch or twice the diameter of the water supply outlet whichever is greater 2 reduced pressure principle backflow prevention assemblies may be used if a the device is installed at a minimum of 12 inches above ground in a location that will ensure that the assembly will not be submerged  and b drainage is provided for any water that may be discharged assembly relief valve 3 pressure vacuum breakers may be used if a no backpressure condition will occur  and b the device is installed at a minimum of 12 inches above any downstream piping and the highest downstream opening popup sprinklers are measured from the retracted position from the top of the sprinkler 4 atmospheric vacuum breakers may be used if a no backpressure will be present  b there are no shutoff valves downstream from the atmospheric vacuum breaker  c the device is installed at a minimum of six inches above any downstream piping and the highest downstream opening popup sprinklers are measured from the retracted position from the top of the sprinkler  d there is no continuous pressure on the supply side of the atmospheric vacuum breaker for more than 12 hours in any 24hour period  and e a separate atmospheric vacuum breaker is installed on the discharge side of each irrigation control valve between the valve and all the emission devices that the valve controls c backflow prevention devices used in applications designated as health hazards must be tested upon installation and annually thereafter d if there are no conditions that present a health hazard double check valve backflow prevention assemblies may be used to prevent backflow if the device is tested upon installation and 1 backpressure caused by an elevation of pressure in the discharge piping by pump or elevation of piping above the supply pressure which could cause a reversal of the normal flow of water or backsiphonage conditions caused by a reduced or negative pressure in the irrigation system exist  and 2 test cocks are used for testing only e if a double check valve is installed below ground 1 test cocks must be plugged except when the double check valve is being tested  2 test cock plugs must be threaded watertight and made of nonferrous material  3 a ytype strainer is installed on the inlet side of the double check valve  4 there must be a clearance between any fill material and the bottom of the double check valve to allow space for testing and repair  and 5 there must be space on the side of the double check valve to test and repair the double check valve f if an irrigation system is connected to a potable water supply double check valve pressure vacuum breaker or reduced pressure principle backflow assembly and includes an automatic master valve on the system the automatic master valve must be installed on the discharge side of the backflow prevention assembly g the irrigator shall ensure the backflow prevention device is tested prior to being placed in service and the test results shall be provided to the city and to the irrigation systems owner or owners representative within ten business days of testing of the backflow prevention device  ii 3212017 specific conditions and commission of the city of nacogdoches makes the following findings a due to limited quantity and low quality there are areas of shallow groundwater supplies within the city and its etj that are not valuable as potable water sources and therefore are not utilized for potable water  b a number of commercial and industrial properties in nacogdoches and its etj are underlain with unusable groundwater that has become contaminated by historical onsite or offsite sources  c the city of nacogdoches uses groundwater from the downdip portion of the carrizo aquifer as part of its public water supply but the outcrop of the carrizo aquifer does not extend into the corporate limits or etj of the city  d the use of municipal setting designations within nacogdoches and its etj allows for a stateevaluated corrective action process for groundwater that is directed toward protection of human health and the environment balanced with the economic welfare of the citizens of the city  e where public drinking water is available the potable use of groundwater in msds should be prohibited to protect public health and welfare when the quality of the groundwater presents an actual or potential threat to human health  and f the city of nacogdoches inhabitants should be given the opportunity to comment on proposals to designate an area as a msd and public input should be considered when deciding whether to grant a msd application  1 1132009 definitions affected community means those persons entitled to notice in section 106724b7 below authorized representative means for purposes of source prohibited a a person commits an offense if the person intentionally knowingly or with criminal negligence uses groundwater in a municipal setting designation area as a potable water source b a that municipal setting designation  3 1132009 application for city commission approval of municipal setting designation a a person including the city of nacogdoches seeking city commission approval of payment of the road maintenance fee for any location which is defined by section 106351 of the ordinances of the city of nacogdoches texas as an industrial user residential utility service customer shall for purposes of this article mean a benefitted property city utility service account or the person firm partnership joint venture association corporation nonprofit organization governmental is assessed against and collected from owners or occupants of benefitted property within city limits for the purpose of planning constructing operating monitoring and maintaining the transportation system of the city transportation system or road system shall mean the structures traffic controls streets and other facilities in the public rightofway such as bridges sidewalks and alleys which are dedicated to the use of motor vehicles transit bicycles and pedestrians all of which are owned andor controlled in whole by the city and which are dedicated to the transportation system service of the city including provisions for additions improvements and extensions to such system utility customer shall mean the holder of a city utility service account or the person firm partnership joint venture association corporation governmental entity or other entity responsible for the payment of the road maintenance fee  ii 1252017 establishment and revision of roadway maintenance fee a the city council hereby establishes a roadway maintenance fee to be paid by benefitted property utility customers within the city limits of nacogdoches texas such roadway maintenance fee shall be set in amounts which will provide sufficient funds to properly maintain the transportation system b collection of the roadway maintenance fee against each benefitted property shall be made by a monthly charge to be added to the benefitted property utility customers utility bill for such property c the city council has established a fee schedule based upon the cost of maintaining the transportation system as follows 1 single family residential benefitted property utility service customers shall be charged $500 per month for each such property 2 multifamily residential benefitted property utility service customers shall be charged $250 per month for each dwelling unit located on each such property 3 commercial benefitted property utility service customers shall be charged $750 per month for each such property 4 industrial benefitted property utility service customers shall be charged $1500 per month for each such property d the above stated fee schedule may be amended by the city council based upon changes in the cost of maintaining the transportation system e the roadway maintenance fund shall not be used to supplant funding of $50000000 annually from the general fund of the city for roadway maintenance  iii 1252017 roadway maintenance fund a a separate fund shall be created effective  known as the roadway maintenance fund all roadway maintenance fees shall be deposited in the roadway maintenance fund it shall not be necessary for the expenditures from the roadway maintenance fund to specifically relate to any particular property from which the roadway maintenance fees were collected b an annual report of the roadway maintenance fund and the roadway maintenance fee program will be provided to the city council  iii 1252017 billing and collection of fee the roadway maintenance fee shall be billed and collected with the monthly utility bill all such bills shall be rendered monthly and shall be due upon receipt  iii 1252017 recovery of unpaid fee any roadway maintenance fee due hereunder which is not paid when due may be recovered in action at law by the city in addition to any other remedies or penalties provided by this the ordinances city of nacogdoches texas failure of any utility customer to pay the roadway maintenance fee promptly when due shall subject such utility customer to the discontinuance of utility services provided by the city  iii 1252017 administration  rules and regulations the city manager or designee shall be responsible for the administration of this article the city manager or designee shall be responsible for developing rules regulations and procedures for the administration of fees and the consideration of petitions for modification and appeals pertaining to the fees charged hereunder  developing maintenance programs  establishing transportation system criteria and standards for the operation and maintenance of the transportation system  iii 1252017 disposition of fees and charges a the roadway maintenance fee shall not be used for the general government proprietary purposes of the city except to pay for the equitable share of the cost of accounting management and government thereof b other than as described above the roadway maintenance fee shall be used solely to pay for the costs of operation administration planning engineering development of guidelines and controls inspection maintenance repair improvement renewal replacement and reconstruction of the transportation system and costs incidental thereto  iii 1252017 exemption a the city reserves the right to exempt benefitted properties from provisions of this article council action b the following benefitted properties are immediately exempted from the provisions of this article 1 benefitted property owned or controlled by the nacogdoches independent school district 2 benefitted property owned or controlled by stephen f austin state university 3 benefitted property owned or controlled by nacogdoches county 4 upon verification of proper governmental status and issuance of written approval by the city manager or city managers designee benefitted property owned or controlled by the state of texas 5 upon verification of proper governmental status and issuance of written approval by the city manager or city managers designee benefitted property owned or controlled by the federal government  iii 1252017   ii 4172018 appeals a a utility customer may appeal the roadway maintenance fee established herein pursuant to the procedure set forth in this section and as set out in any process developed by the assessed for a benefitted property unaffiliated to the utility customers utility account d the city manager or his designee shall render a written decision on such appeals within a reasonable time after receipt of a timely written notice of appeal from the utility customer this decision will be final e during all periods of appeal the utility customer shall be responsible for payment of roadway maintenance fee charges in full f a utility customer appealing the roadway maintenance fee may not receive a refund resulting from the appeal except for a road maintenance fee paid within six months of transportation by taxicab limousine or shuttle the term license when used alone shall apply to the authorization made to the franchise holder which is a license to operate one or more taxicabs limousine shall mean a luxury sedan with a manufactures rated seating capacity of not more than 15 passengers used for the transportation of passengers for hire from a location in the city to another location either inside or outside the city having a driver furnished as part of the service and which operates on a prearranged basis only whereby such prearrangement is made not less than one hour in advance of the time transportation is to begin expressly excluded from this definition are limousines used exclusively in connection with funeral services and free shuttle services offered by hotels and extras owner shall mean any person firm corporation association partnership or society who has the control direction maintenance and the benefit of the collection of revenue derived from the operation of taxicabs limousines or shuttles on or over the streets or public ways of the city whether as owner or otherwise except drivers as hereinafter defined public convenience and necessity shall mean a public convenience which is fitting and suited to public need and a public necessity which embraces a great and urgent public convenience this term as applied to a proposed service by an applicant shall mean that the applicant is fit able and willing to perform transportation by taxicab limousine or shuttle in accordance with the requirements of this chapter and that public convenience and necessity require the service proposed by such applicant taxi stand shall mean and include the taxi depot at which place the taxicabs shall be housed or parked and at which place the telephone calls and requests for service shall be made and at which place a dispatcher shall control the movements of the taxicabs to the points of request for such service this term shall likewise be synonymous with taxi terminal and shall mean and embrace that space and area of land and buildings off of the streets of the city and upon private property and shall be and constitute the main office of the owner and taxicab operator taxicab shall mean every automobile or motor propelled vehicle used for transportation of passengers for hire over the public streets of the city not over a defined or fixed route and irrespective of whether or not the operations extend beyond the city limits of the city at rates for distance traveled or for wait time or for both or at rates per hour per week or per month which such vehicles is routed to destinations under the direction of such passenger or passengers or such person or persons hiring the same  provided however that the term taxicab shall not apply to motor buses operated within the city under a franchise from the city over a fixed or definite route nor shall such term apply to motor buses regularly operated in the city along with fixed routes to and from points outside the incorporated limits of the city nor shall such term apply to motor vehicles regularly engaged in interstate commerce nor shall such term apply to limousines or shuttles as defined in this section shuttle shall mean a sedan or van with a manufactures rated seating capacity of not more than 15 passengers used for the transportation of passengers for hire from a location in the city to another location either inside or outside the city having a driver furnished as part of the service and which operates on a prearranged basis only whereby such prearrangement is made not less than one hour in advance of the time transportation is to begin expressly excluded from this definition are shuttles used exclusively in connection with free shuttle services offered by hotels motels and area attractions taximeter shall mean a meter instrument or device attached to a taxicab which measures mechanicallyelectronically the distance driven and waiting time upon which the fare is based taxicab limousine or shuttle license means the approval under the terms of division 3 of this article of the vehicle to be operated as a taxicab limousine or shuttle and shall be obtained from the chief of police before operating a taxicab limousine or shuttle in the city waiting time shall mean such time as may be consumed or lost at the special instance and request of a passenger after such passenger has first entered the taxicab to make a trip and before reaching his final destination  and no charge shall be made against a passenger for any other time lost on account of any other delay whatsoever      11172009   2 1172017 cross reference definitions generally  12 duties of city council generally a to make reasonable orders respecting character extent for each 10 mile or fraction thereof traveled thereafter the rate for additional passengers shall be $100 per passenger not to exceed the vehicles maximum seating capacity with a minimum trip fare of $450 b for each one minute of waiting time consumed by the taxicab at the instance of the passenger the rate shall be $025 c whenever a taxicab is engaged on an hourly basis whether for one or more passengers the rate of fare shall be $2500 for each hour for each quarter hour in excess of each completed hour the rate shall be $625 for each quarter hour the taxicab is so engaged d this section shall not apply to limousines or shuttles    display of rates a card showing the rates charged by a taxicab shall be displayed in a conspicuous place on the inside of each taxicab and on the back of required a it shall be unlawful for any taxicab to be operated or advertised for public hire in the city unless it is equipped with a taximeter which taximeter shall be used as provided in this section b it shall be unlawful for any person owning operating driving or in charge of any taxicab for hire in the city to drive or operate such taxicab or to use or advertise in connection therewith the word taxi taxicab or cab or in soliciting trade from the public to represent or exhibit such vehicle as a taxi taxicab or cab unless each vehicle be equipped with a taximeter c the taximeter requirements stated herein shall not be applicable to limousines or shuttles    use in determining fare it shall be unlawful for any person owning operating driving or in charge of a taxicab to operate or drive such taxicab unless a taximeter is used in determining the fare to be charged and no other or different fare shall be charged than the fare recorded on the reading face of such taximeter for such trip and no other rates or methods of measuring the distance or time charges shall be allowed except as expressly permitted by this division this section shall not apply to limousines or shuttles    size design specifications every taxicab shall use a taximeter which shall conform to the following specifications 1 the taximeter shall be a mechanicalelectric instrument or device by which the charge for hire of a taxicab is mechanicallyelectronically calculated for the distance traveled for waiting time if any and extra passengers if any and upon which such charge or charges shall be indicated by means of clearly legible figures which are electrically lighted each time the taximeter flag is thrown from nonearning to earning position 2 every taximeter must register upon visual counters the following items a total miles unless shown by accurate registration on the speedometer tested in good working order on the taxicab b paid miles c number of trips 3 each taximeter must be driven from the taxicab transmission to the taximeter head 4 no taximeter shall be in such condition as to be more than five percent incorrect to the prejudice of any passenger this section shall not apply to limousines or shuttles    case to be sealed  cover and gear intact no person shall use or permit to be used or driven for hire a taxicab equipped with a taximeter the case of which is unsealed and not having its cover and gear in tact this section shall not apply to limousines or shuttles    tests and inspections generally all taximeters used in the city shall be kept in good repair and functioning accurately the city may require each taximeter tested for accuracy by the appropriate responsible state agency andor by any private company capable of performing such test proof of accuracy from such test shall be submitted to the chief of police the actual cost of the test shall be borne by the owner or operator of the taxicab this section shall not apply to limousines or shuttles    changing flag to vacant position it shall be the duty of the driver to call to the attention of passengers to the amount registered on the taximeter and the taximeter flag shall not be changed to vacant position until after the fare is paid this section shall not apply to limousines or shuttles    unauthorized display of signal no driver of a taxicab equipped with a taximeter while carrying a passenger or passengers or while under employment shall display the signal affixed to such taximeter in such position as to denote the vehicle is not employed or in such position as to denote that the taxicab is employed at a rate of or different from that which the use of the taxicab legally justified under the provisions of this division this section shall not apply to limousines or shuttles    multiple passengers the first passenger employing a taxicab shall be entitled to its exclusive use until delivered to his destination by the most practical direct route and no other passenger may be carried unless the passenger or passengers first engaged the taxicab shall consent to additional passengers not with him or her party this section shall not apply to pulled by a horse carriage horse means any horse or any animal in the horse family which is used by its owner in exchange for a fee a horse rented or leased by its owner to another for any of the purposes set forth in this article shall be deemed to be a carriage horse for the purpose of this article chief of police means the administrative head of the police department or his designee officer means the representative of the city whose primary duty is to enforce various codes related to property appearance and various nuisances franchise or license to operate means an authority issued by operator of a horsedrawn carriage service which authorizes the owner or operator to engage in the business of transportation by horsedrawn carriage holder means a person who is granted a permit under this article horsedrawn carriage driver means any individual duly licensed as a driver by the state as required by this article and who operates or has been duly employed to operate a horsedrawn carriage by the holder of a horsedrawn carriage permit horsedrawn carriage service means a service offered to a passenger as transportation under this article operating authority means a permit issued under the provisions of this article passenger means an individual other than the driver being transported by horsedrawn carriage permit means permission granted by the city to operate a horsedrawn carriage for hire within the city for a period of 12 months and renewable under the provisions of this article  provided however that the permission granted is neither expired nor revoked person means an individual partnership corporation company association or a joint stock association owning driving controlling or operating any horsedrawn carriage as defined and regulated by this article public convenience and necessity means a public convenience which is fitting and suited to public need and a public necessity which embraces a great and urgent public convenience this term as applied to a proposed service by an applicant shall mean that the applicant is fit able and willing to perform transportation by horsedrawn carriage in accordance with the requirements of this article and that public convenience and necessity require the service proposed by such applicant street means and includes any street alley avenue boulevard drive public way or highway commonly used for the purpose of public travel within the corporated limits of the city work as applied to a horse and carriage means the horse is out of its stable and presented to the public as being available for pulling a passengers the general public or the horse 1 remove a horse from a public street until such time as the horse is reexamined by a veterinarian of this state and the permit holder obtains a certificate from that veterinarian stating the horse has been personally examined by him and such horse is fit to return to work in the horsedrawn carriage business 2 remove a carriage from the street when it is the provisions of this article shall be a class c misdemeanor each offense is punishable by a fine of not more than $50000 but not less than $2500  9192000 declaration of public convenience and shall not be necessary in the following instances 1 for the annual renewal of the same number of licenses in force 2 for the renewal of licenses to the applicant for the number of horsedrawn carriages shall have been duly licensed and operated by such applicant during the year previous to the year for which such renewal is sought  9192000   11172009 criteria for determination of public convenience and necessity a in determining whether public convenience and necessity require the licensing of horsedrawn carriage services for which application may be made the city council shall take into consideration 1 whether the demands of public convenience and necessity require such proposed or such additional horsedrawn carriage service within the city 2 the financial responsibility of the applicant 3 the number kind and type of equipment to be used by the applicant 4 the increased traffic congestion on the streets of the city which may result from the licensing of additional horsedrawn carriages 5 whether the safe use of the streets of the city by the public both vehicular and pedestrian will be unduly endangered by the granting of such additional license 6 whether the applicant is fit able and willing to perform transportation by horsedrawn carriage 7 other relevant facts as the city council may deem advisable or necessary which may throw light on public necessity and convenience b no application will be granted and no finding shall be made of public convenience and necessity unless and until there is a finding that such applicant is fit able and willing to perform transportation by horsedrawn carriage as provided by this article and that there is public demand and need for the type of service proposed c a refusal on the part of the holders of franchises to meet public convenience and necessity shall constitute just cause for a finding of additional need of public convenience and necessity and thereby authorize the city council to issue additional franchises individuals in accidents resulting from any cause for which the operator andor vehicle driver would be liable on account of liability imposed by law regardless of whether the vehicle was being driven provision making the city an additional insured under such policy or contract of insurance d every insurance policy or contract of insurance required under this section shall contain a provision for responsibility of the holder to select and employ drivers who are qualified to operate horsedrawn carriages and who are familiar with the streets within the city where horsedrawn carriages are allowed to operate the holder shall submit to the city manager and the chief of police a roster of all drivers prior to operating horsedrawn carriages the holder shall not permit any person not on that roster to drive a horsedrawn carriage under his control  9192000 conduct of drivers while on duty a driver of a horsedrawn carriage shall 1 conduct himselfherself in a reasonable prudent and courteous manner  2 maintain a sanitary and wellgroomed appearance  3 not consume nor report to duty within 12 hours after consuming alcoholic beverages or drugs  4 not solicit passengers in a loud or annoying tone of voice or by any manner annoying any person or obstruct the movement of any person for the purpose of soliciting patronage  5 not permit any unauthorized person to operate carriages under his control  6 not permit persons to ride or sit on horses under his control  7 not leave a horse unattended at any time  8 not permit a horse to drop excrement from its diaper  9 empty diapers of all excrement when half full and at the beginning of each trip  10 keep all routes and carriage staging areas clean and free of animal excrement  11 walk a horse at a pace not faster than slow trot when transporting passengers  12 not allow passengers to stand hang over the side or ride on the back of the carriage  13 not allow passengers to engage in horseplay while in the carriage  14 not permit anyone on the carriage who is intoxicated  15 not allow alcoholic beverages to be brought on or consumed on the carriage  16 have in his possession his state drivers license when operating a horsedrawn carriage  17 comply with state motor vehicle laws governing the operation of a motor vehicle while operating a horsedrawn carriage on a public roadway within the city  9192000 public other debris created in the course of operating a horsedrawn carriage a trash receptacle shall be maintained by the licensee at the loadingunloading site b disposal of manure shall be the responsibility of the permit holder and must be transported to an approved disposal area c where excrement has been removed from the route street or the staging area water will be used to thoroughly request city manager and approval granted minimum and maximum fares must be visibly posted at all embarkment points  9192000 secs 110407110425  reserved division 5  maintenance and safety requirements for horses and equipment identification health certificate required for horses a no person shall use or offer the use of a horse not described in the application for the permit to operate a horsedrawn carriage service for the purpose of this article the use of a horsedrawn carriage service means that a horse is used or offered for use to the public for a fee for the purpose of operating a horsedrawn vehicle for hire b the application shall contain the name and address of the owner of each horse to be used by the holder or his employee for the purpose of pulling a horsedrawn vehicle the age sex color markings and any other identifying marks such as brands or tattoos shall be listed in the application should there be a need for a horse previously identified on the application to be replaced or should the franchisee or licensee wish to permit additional horses the city manager shall be provided all necessary information for the health certificate and the animal inspected by the code enforcement officer prior to being put in service c the applicant for a horsedrawn carriage permit shall at the time of application present to the city manager a health certificate for each horse to be used the holder or applicant shall at his own expense have each horse examined by a licensed veterinarian before it is put in service the health certificate will be valid for a period of 90 days from the date of issuance by the veterinarian the certificate of health from the veterinarian shall contain a statement certifying the horse is physically sound is free of disease and is capable of being used to pull a horsedrawn carriage the health certificate shall also contain the following information 1 the examination record of the horse in use  2 a picture of the horse  3 weight of the horse minimum weight 1000 pounds  4 description and location of any identifying characteristics marks brands andor tattoos  5 description of any mechanical lameness which would not cause pain or suffering to the horse during use  and 6 a record of annual immunization for rabies venezuelan equine encephalomyelitis eastern and western equine encephalomyelitis tetanus influenza and annual negative coggins test  9192000 health and safety requirements for horses a a permit holder pursuant to this article shall ensure that appropriate and sufficient food and drinking water are available for each horse and that while working each horse is permitted to eat at reasonable intervals and permitted to have access to drinking water as may be necessary b permit holders shall not allow a horse to be worked during adverse weather or other dangerous conditions which are a threat to the health or safety of the horse passengers or general public c permit holders and drivers shall ensure that carriage horses are not worked for more than eight hours in a continuous 24hour period d a carriage horse required to be registered pursuant to this article which is lame or suffers from a physical condition or illness making it unsuitable for work may be ordered to be removed from work by a police officer the code enforcement officer or the city manager a horse for which such order has been issued shall not be returned to work until it has recovered from the condition for which the order was issued before returning to work the permit holder shall submit a statement from a veterinarian certifying that the condition no longer exists and the horse is fit to return to service e the permit holder shall in the operation of a horsedrawn carriage use only horses which are geldings or mares at a minimum of three years old which weigh at least 1000 pounds the horse shall be in such physical condition to perform the task without undue stress and effort the permit holder shall ensure the horse has the stamina and physical ability to perform the work and duties required f the permit holder will ensure that the horse has been treated for internal parasites within the past four months under the direction of a veterinarian the permit holder shall treat the horse for external parasites whenever found to be present g the permit holder shall ensure the hooves of the carriage horses are trimmed and their shoes are reset before placing them in service using caulks or borium to prevent slippage h permit holders and drivers shall ensure that carriage horses are kept clean at all times especially those areas in contact with harnesses or other tack i permit holders and drivers shall ensure that pads and other pieces of padded tack are kept clean and in safe and serviceable condition j the following shall deem a horse unfit for service and be cause for removal from service 1 lameness of any kind except that of a mechanical nature listed on the health certificate 2 open sores or wounds caused or likely to be irritated by the bearing surfaces of harness bridle girth or other tack 3 obvious signs of emaciation dehydration or exhaustion 4 loose shoes or unsafe or unserviceable tack  9192000 barns stables or other housing required  location the permit holder pursuant to this article shall be responsible for providing adequate housing for horses and carriages when not in service barns stables or other housing for horses and carriages shall be situated in areas properly zoned for such use horses and carriages shall at no time be stabled in a business or residential area of the city unless so zoned for such use  9192000 seating capacity of carriages  occupation by minors a each carriage operated under this article will have the seating capacity listed on the application for each carriage to be operated the seating capacity of each carriage will be subject to approval of the chief of police under no circumstances will the number of passengers exceed the approved capacity a baby inarms shall not be deemed to occupy a seat b a parent guardian or other adult responsible for that child must accompany children under 12 years of age  9192000 safety and sanitation of carriages a horsedrawn carriages will be kept clean and free of refuse carriages shall be kept in safe operating condition carriages and wheels shall not have any visible cracks broken or missing parts or visible damage all required safety equipment shall be in good and operable condition wheels shall be firmly attached to the hub and shall not wobble excessively carriages using rubber tires shall meet those standards set forth in the state motor vehicle law for a motor vehicle all springs axles and supporting structures shall be intact without any visible breaks or deflection greater than incurred by a normal load b unless otherwise provided for in this article while working each horse shall wear a properly fitted diaper that prevents excrement from being deposited on the streets if the city manager determines that such equipment ie diaper is not readily manufactured andor available for the horse utilized by the permittee the city manager may waive such equipment requirement such waiver must be in writing signed by the city manager andor his designee  however such waiver shall not modify andor reduce the other obligations imposed upon the permittee by this article c the holder will provide proper cleaning equipment for the removal of excrement from streets and loading areas shovels brooms and adequate water supply d the holder will provide a closed container for the disposal of excrement  containers will be emptied periodically and will not be allowed to cause an offensive odor containers will be removed from staging areas at the end of each working day  9192000 inspection and identification of carriages and equipment the code enforcement officer will inspect horsedrawn carriages and equipment before they are put in service and at his discretion there after the permit holder is required to identify each carriage listed in the permit by a visible number painted or placed on an attached placard on each carriage each carriage in service will have a copy of the permit to operate as a horsedrawn carriage on board  9192000 lighting requirements generally a lighting requirements for horsedrawn carriages operating in the city limits are established to make carriages as safe as possible for passengers and to enable vehicular traffic to see and avoid collisions with these carriages a strong consideration for lighting requirements is the fact that carriages have no generators and must rely on battery power for their lights because of this the use of commonly available bulb and lighting fixtures and reflectors are required b to avoid maintenance problems with batteries it is suggested that operators utilize deep cycle batteries such as those used in marine or rv applications these batteries are only a suggestion and are not mandatory although they will perform more efficiently than a standard automobile battery under the conditions for which they are used  9192000 carriage rear lighting a two red lights and two red reflectors shall be mounted on and visible from the rear of the horsedrawn carriage the reflectors shall be at least three inches in diameter or seven square inches in area the red lamps shall be at least four inches in diameter and shall be mounted as far to either side of the carriage rear as possible b the lamps shall be mounted above the reflectors and no higher than five feet from the ground the reflectors shall be mounted as far as practical below the lamps on the rear of the carriage but no lower than two feet from the ground c bulbs of at least 32 candlepower designated by the trade lamp number 1156 shall be used in the lamp it is rated at 12 volts and draws two amps when lit  9192000 carriage front lighting a one lamp displaying a white light shall be mounted on and visible from the front of the horsedrawn carriage this lamp shall be at least four inches in diameter and use a 32candlepower number 1156 bulb it shall be placed as far to the left looking forward as possible and shall not be obscured from view by the person driving the carriage passengers or the animals pulling the carriage it shall be mounted no less than two feet nor more than five feet from the ground as measured from the center of the lens b all lamps on the horsedrawn carriage shall be in operation during the nighttime hours from a halfhour after sunset to a halfhour before sunrise or at any time when weather conditions cause visibility to be reduced from normal daytime visibility the wiring for all lamps shall be so mounted and maintained so that it is not damaged by persons entering or exiting the carriage nor create a danger to any passenger  9192000 side reflectors a each horsedrawn carriage will have six additional reflectors two reflectors will be mounted on each side of the carriage as far apart to the front and rear b also one reflector will be mounted on each side of the animal pulling the carriage either attached to the harness of the animal or on the draw bars of the carriage and as far as possible toward the front of the horse where more than one horse is used to pull the carriage each horse will have one reflector mounted on each side c all the reflectors mentioned in this section shall be white yellow or amber in color and shall be at least three inches in diameter or seven square inches in size d white reflectors mounted on the side of a horse or carriage shall not face the rear of the carriage reflectors will be visible for a distance of 600 feet when illuminated by the lawful low beams of headlamps all reflectors will be mounted no less than two feet nor more than five feet off the ground as measured from the center of the lens  9192000 slowmoving vehicles emblem required a every horsedrawn carriage shall display a slowmoving vehicle emblem on the rear and center of the carriage the emblem shall be a 1334inch fluorescent orange triangle with a one and fiveeighthsinch red reflective border giving a total width of 16 inches by 14 in height this emblem will meet the current standards adopted by the american society of agriculture engineers and will be visible in daylight or at night when illuminated by the lawful lower beams of headlamps for a distance of not less than 500 feet it will be mounted base down in the rear center of the carriage not less than three feet nor more than five feet from the ground as measured from the base of the emblem no decoration trim or any part of the carriage shall cover or obscure any part of the emblem at any time b all lamps and reflectors and the emblem shall be maintained in a clean visible condition at all times the electrical supply to such lamps will be maintained to provide sufficient power so the lamps are visible at night for a distance of at least 1000 feet  9192000 waterways footnotes  1  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 14  environment ch 34  floods ch 42  manufactured homes mobile homes and parks ch 66  parks and recreation ch 74  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 86  subdivisions ch 90  zoning ch 118 article i  in general secs 114111425  reserved article ii  lake nacogdoches rules and regulations division 1  generally assumption of risk the city shall not be liable to any person on account of the loss or damage of any property that may be placed in or upon lake nacogdoches nor shall the city be liable to any person whomsoever on account of personal injuries or loss of life that may be sustained by any person in or upon lake nacogdoches any person entering in or upon the lake shall do so at his sole risk and shall not be privileged to enter or remain in or upon such reservoir save and except under the terms of this article that have been or may be adopted by the city council nor shall the city be responsible or liable in such instances as set out in this section    11172009 waiver the city council may upon application and after hearing waive for a specified length of time such of the terms provisions and conditions of this article that may be deemed appropriate for the accommodation of water carnivals shows boat races educational purposes exhibitions and other special events as may be permitted from time to time and subject to such safety measures as the city council may require    11172009 use of area between elevation 286 and water level a for the purpose of this article the lake shall be defined as including not only the body of water known as lake nacogdoches but also all of that area between the water level as such may advance or recede and the elevation of 286 feet above mean sea level msl b owners of record of land contiguous to elevation 286 msl shall have the joint right with the city to the use of the land between elevation 286 and the water level subject to the citys right power and duty to make regulations ordinances and other requirements deemed necessary by it in the construction maintenance and operation of lake nacogdoches as a water source  domesticated animals prohibited all domesticated animals are prohibited from lake nacogdoches its parks and beaches except that dogs may be used by persons engaged in the lawful exercise of waterfowl hunting only for the purpose of retrieving dead or wounded waterfowl in lake nacogdoches and for the purpose of training dogs for such such training andor retrieval shall take place only north of the electric transmission lines crossing lake nacogdoches and from 30 days prior to the beginning of each waterfowl season as set by the state or the united states or their agencies until the end of each waterfowl season such dogs shall be kept on a leash and confined within a boat or other motor vehicle while on lake nacogdoches south of the electric transmission line any boatramp parking area roadway or other area of lake property and must be transported forthwith and by the most direct route to the area north of the electric transmission line  glass beverage containers it shall be unlawful for any person to bring any glass beverage container into the lake nacogdoches eastside and westside parks their beaches andor parking areas  swimming area hours all swimming areas at lake nacogdoches shall be closed at sundown with all other park areas and facilities being closed at  pm with the exception of the boatramps parking lots and restrooms  livestock no animal pens corrals or barns shall be constructed within 500 feet measured horizontally from the 286foot elevation or at any point from which drainage may run in to lake nacogdoches or into any stream which lies within the lake nacogdoches watershed  wells all wells at lake nacogdoches must be driven or bored and properly cased and shall be installed and maintained in such a matter as to meet the requirements of the state health department  garbage and trash no garbage trash refuse dead animals fish vegetables food ashes offal fecal matter cans bottles glass rubbish or filth of any kind shall be placed or be permitted to be placed in the water of lake nacogdoches or situated in such a manner that it will drain toward or reach the water of lake nacogdoches  cross reference solid waste ch 82 launching at authorized points no person shall launch a boat or other watercraft on lake nacogdoches except at points designated and authorized by the city council however this section shall not apply to privately owned boatramps being used by the owner or his guests any privately owned launching ramp or device shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with the requirements of division 5 of this article relating to docks and other structures    11172009 traffic rules a the following traffic rules shall be observed by boats and other watercraft operating on lake nacogdoches 1 passing when two boats or other watercraft are approaching each other head on or nearly so so as to involve risk of collision it shall be the duty of each boat to bear to the right and pass the other boat on its left side 2 rightofway when boats approach each other obliquely or at right angles the boat approaching on the right side has the rightofway 3 overtaking one boat may overtake another on either side but must grant the rightofway to the overtaken boat 4 sailboats sailboats have the rightofway over all other boats b except as otherwise expressly provided in this article the water safety act vtca parks and wildlife et seq applicable to the operation of small boats is made a part of this article  reckless driving and speeding a every operator of a boat or other watercraft on lake nacogdoches shall at all times navigate the boat or watercraft in a careful and prudent manner and at such rate of speed as not to endanger the life limb or property of any person b reckless navigation of any boat or watercraft on lake nacogdoches shall include operating the boat or watercraft in a manner which unnecessarily interferes with the free and proper use of the water of the lake or unnecessarily endangers other boats and watercraft on the lake or the life and limb of any person c no person shall operate any boat or other watercraft on lake nacogdoches at a rate of speed greater than will permit by the exercise of reasonable care such boat to be brought to a stop within the assured clear distance ahead d boat operators in areas adjacent to public ramp launching facilities whether designated by marker buoys or not shall limit their motor boats to a nowake speed five mph  state law reference excessive speed vtca parks and wildlife reckless or negligent operation no person shall operate any motorboat or vessel or manipulate any water skis aquaplane or similar device in a willfully or wantonly reckless or negligent manner that endangers the life limb or property of any person on lake nacogdoches  state law reference reckless operation vtca parks and wildlife obstruction of boat launching facilities no person shall anchor a boat or other watercraft for fishing or other purposes on lake nacogdoches in such a position as to obstruct the entrances or exits to the public or private boat launching facilities  state law reference obstructing passage vtca parks and wildlife mooring and buoys no person shall at any time moor any boat or other watercraft to any buoy beacon or sign placed on lake nacogdoches nor shall any person in any manner hang on with a boat to such buoy beacon or sign  anchoring no person shall leave a boat or any other watercraft on lake nacogdoches without having the boat or watercraft dependably fastened to an anchorage either in the water or upon the land or any such boat or other watercraft must be removed from the water a sufficient distance to ensure that the boat or watercraft will not be caused to float away from its placement because of rising waters no boat or other watercraft shall be permitted to remain anchored upon land but can be within a boathouse or dock or entirely removed from the lake  accidents if the operator of any boat or watercraft involved in an accident on lake nacogdoches resulting in injury or death to any person or in damage to property he shall so far as he can do so without danger to his own vessel crew and passengers if any render to other persons affected by the collision such assistance as may be practicable and give his name address full identification of his boat and the name and address of the owner of the boat struck or the operator or occupants of the boats collided with and shall report such accident immediately to the lake officer the police department or the state parks and wildlife department  state law reference accidents vtca parks and wildlife water sports skiing surf boarding and other comparable water sports shall be governed as follows 1 the term skiing as used in section  or anywhere else in the rules and regulations of lake nacogdoches shall be defined as the use of any equipment of any kind or character whose purpose is to pull or propel a human body on or over the surface of lake nacogdoches it is further specified that sailboats are exempted from this definition 2 boats towing people engaged in such activities shall go no nearer than 200 feet of shore docks persons swimming or other boats except when leaving and returning to the dock 3 such activity shall not be engaged in between sunset and sunrise nor shall any person operate a boat for the purpose of towing persons engaged in such activities between sunset and sunrise 4 no other boat or watercraft shall follow closer than 200 feet behind persons engaged in such activity 5 scuba diving is allowed in the lake only in areas within 140 feet of a shoreline except for emergency rescue or salvage operations or for special events for which exceptions may be granted by the lake officer scuba diving in other areas is prohibited 6 each diver must be accompanied by at least one other diver 7 a warning flag reading diver below shall be displayed on the waters surface on a buoy or boat in the area where scuba diving is in progress the sign must be readable from 100 feet and must be removed when the divers return to the boat 8 scuba diving will not be carried on where it will interfere with normal boat traffic 9 a tow boat pulling water skiers must be equipped with a rearview mirror as specified by the state water safety act 10 skiing in the northern end of lake nacogdoches shall be prohibited in areas marked by buoys 11 skiing shall be prohibited on lake nacogdoches in all areas north of the existing overhead electrical transmission lines this area shall be marked with noskiing buoys or signs at such locations as deemed appropriate by the lake officer 12 swimming only areas will be designated by marker buoys  state law reference personal watercraft vtca parks and wildlife lights no boat shall be operated on lake nacogdoches between sunset and sunrise unless the lights required by the state water safety act vtca parks and wildlife shall be operating and lighted in addition all motorboats less than 16 feet in length regardless of the motors horsepower shall have lights as required by the state water safety act for class 1 boats  state law reference lights vtca parks and wildlife capacity of watercraft no person owning or operating a boat or other watercraft on lake nacogdoches shall permit the boat or watercraft to be occupied by more than the rated capacity of such boat or other watercraft nor shall any person owning or operating a watercraft on the lake permit the watercraft to be loaded with passengers or cargo beyond its safe capacity taking into consideration weather and other operating conditions  life preservers every boat or watercraft operating on lake nacogdoches must be equipped with one life preserver per person life preservers shall be of an approved type adequate to sustain afloat any occupant of the boat children under the age of 13 must wear a life preserver at all times while the boat is in motion on the lake  state law reference life preservers vtca parks and wildlife flotation devices no boat or other watercraft shall be operated on lake nacogdoches unless it is selfsustained either by patent methods compartmentation or composition inboard power boats shall be exempted from this section the lake officer may grant for a period not to exceed 30 days permission to use a raft or barge on lake nacogdoches for constructing dredging or other purposes and nothing contained in this section shall prohibit the city and its authorized representatives from using rafts and barges in the operation and maintenance of lake nacogdoches  muffling devices it is unlawful to use a boat propelled by gas gasoline or naphtha on lake nacogdoches unless the boat is provided with a stock factory muffler underwater exhaust or water exhaust manifold capable of adequately muffling the sound of the engine the term adequate muffling shall mean that the motors exhaust at all times be so muffled or suppressed as not to create excessive or unusual noise however the city council in its sole discretion may permit the operation of competitiontype motorboats without muffling devices and subject to such restrictions and regulations as the lake officer may direct    11172009 fire extinguishers fire extinguishers are required in all boats as prescribed by the state water safety act vtca parks and us coast guard approved device for arresting backfire  state law reference flame arrestors backfire traps vtca parks and wildlife ventilators on lake nacogdoches all inboard motorboats using fuel having a flashpoint of 110 degrees fahrenheit or less shall have at least two ventilators fitted with cowls or their equivalent for the purpose of properly and efficiently ventilating the bilge of every engine and fuel compartment in order to remove any inflammable or explosive gases some motorboats so constructed as to have the greater portion of the bilge under the engine and fuel tanks opened and exposed to the natural atmosphere at all times need not be required to be fitted with such ventilators  state law reference ventilators vtca parks and wildlife toilet facilities no boat or any liability whatsoever on the part of the city and the city shall have a lien on the boat or watercraft for all unpaid fees  westside boatramp area the following shall govern the westside boatramp fine as provided in section 114  secs 114149114175  reserved division 5  docks and other structures classification of docks a private docks a private dock shall be any boat dock or structure fixed or floating placed upon the waters of lake nacogdoches for pleasure purposes only and producing no revenue either direct or indirect to the owner b commercial docks a commercial dock shall be any boat dock or structure fixed or floating place upon the waters of lake nacogdoches and used by any person for the purposes of deriving revenue direct or indirect from the dock or structure c public piers public piers shall be any structure fixed or floating placed on public property extending into the waters of lake nacogdoches which is available to the general public for recreational purposes only and producing no revenue either direct or indirect to the owner  permit required no dock wharf boathouse or other structure shall be erected on lake nacogdoches without a written permit from the building inspection department  safety devices all piers docks wharves or other similar fixed structures erected from the shores and into the body of lake nacogdoches shall be marked by placement of red reflectors along the side of the structure directly opposite from the shore and the placement of amber reflectors along the flank side of the structure these reflectors shall be at least three inches in diameter placed at intervals of not more than ten feet between reflectors on all sides of any such pier dock wharf or any similar fixed structure facing the waters of lake nacogdoches  anchoring any piers docks and wharves not of permanent nature but floating may be anchored by the use of anchor lines running out into lake nacogdoches provided such anchor lines do not extend over onto adjoining boundary lines of lots as protracted into the lake and provided such anchor lines are so located as not to block any canal or slough to less than the 30foot clearance required in this division any floatingtype dock wharf or pier must be located close enough to the adjoining property as to be connected to it by a walkway  construction standards a the minimum width of docks piers boathouses and other structures on lake nacogdoches shall be four feet and such shall be constructed in a safe manner wooden materials used shall be treated with a wood preservative boathouses are structures as that term is used in the city building code and persons desiring to construct them shall comply in all respects with such code b no permanent dock shall be constructed to exceed a height of two feet above the elevation of 279 feet above mean sea level c the walk or platform of such docks shall not exceed two feet in height above elevation 279 feet nor shall any such dock extend more than 50 feet into the lake from the 279foot level further no dock shall be so constructed regardless of length as to block any channel or slough it being necessary to leave a minimum of 30 feet of clearance and passageway for boats in the channel or slough all docks must be a minimum of five feet from the side boundary lines of any private lot as such boundary lines would be located if extended or protracted into the lake no dock shall be constructed and projected out into lake nacogdoches by any persons not the owner of the land area from which such dock projects  775 public piers a public piers at lake nacogdoches shall be constructed in accordance to the city building code and electrical code as amended in addition no public pier shall extend horizontally more than 100 feet into the lake from 279 feet above mean sea level b public piers shall be adequately lighted so that they are visible from all directions of lake nacogdoches from a distance of not less than 1000 feet c public piers shall have their boundaries clearly marked with buoys and signage visible not less than 150 feet in all directions projecting out at right angles from all sides of a public pier buoys shall not be spaced farther apart than 20 feet signs shall be placed not farther apart than 50 feet on centers and no less than one sign per pier face will be allowed for any public pier over 50 feet in length beyond elevation 279 no boats shall be allowed within 150 feet of any public pier no swimming shall be allowed within 150 feet from any public pier d maximum occupancy limits shall be established and posted for all public piers by the building official e proper rules shall be posted on all public piers stating no alcoholic beverages no swimming no loud music no parties no fires no fireworks and no cooking a ski jumps and similar structures no ski jumps or structures of such nature shall be constructed or placed upon lake nacogdoches without prior written consent of the city council upon application and such shall not be constructed except at a point designated by the lake officer in such written permit    11172009 buoys signs and beacons no buoys for anchoring boats or other purposes the present tense shall include the future 2 all words in the singular number include the plural number and all words in the plural number include the singular number 3 the term structure includes the word building and the term dwelling includes the terms residence and place of habitation 4 the term person includes corporation copartnership association and individual 5 the term shall is mandatory and not discretionary b undefined terms terms not defined in this section shall have the meanings assigned to them in the city building codes terms not defined in this section or in the building codes in this chapter the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning accessory apartment means an accessory dwelling for the use and occupancy by any person employed on the premises on a fulltime basis for domestic or medical help or family members to the second degree of consanguinity and affinity such dwelling shall not have separate utility services or meters this may also include an accessory dwelling located in a commercial or industrial district to and customarily found in connection with a principal building or use 2 is subordinate to and serves a principal building or a principal use  is subordinate in area extent or purpose to the principal building or principal use served 3 is located on the same lot as the principal building or use served accessory use residential means a subordinate use which is detached from the main building and used for purposes customarily incidental to the residential occupancy of the main building and not involving the conduct of a business or the sale of a service accessory buildings include but are not limited to an automobile storage garage laundry room garden shelter hobby room and mechanical room airport or landing field means a landing facility for fixed wing aircraft containing a purposes the zoning regulations and districts established in this chapter have been made in accordance with a comprehensive plan for the purpose of promoting health safety and the general welfare of the city they have been designed among other things to lessen congestion in the streets  to secure safety from fire panic and other dangers  to provide adequate light and air  to prevent the overcrowding of land  to avoid undue concentration of population  and to facilitate the adequate provision of transportation water sewers schools parks and other public requirements they have been made with reasonable consideration of among other things the character of each district and its peculiar suitability for the particular uses contained therein and with a view of conserving the value of buildings and encouraging the most appropriate use of land throughout the community art i  2 1131998 effective date and applicability a the sections of this chapter shall be effective ten days following its adoption by the city council and its publishing in the newspaper of general circulation b the sections of this chapter supersede all other development regulations governing the development of land within the city these regulations shall apply to all land property and development in the city except as expressly and specifically provided otherwise in this chapter no development shall be undertaken without prior authorization pursuant to this chapter art i  3 1131998   11172009 relationship to comprehensive plan and thoroughfare plan this chapter is intended to implement the policies and objectives contained in the comprehensive plan for the city and to affect the citys plan for provision of public facilities and services within city limits and within the citys extraterritorial jurisdiction if a zoning or rezoning request differs from what the comprehensive plan recommends for that area the city planner will advise the applicant of this and will request the applicant to submit a written letter stating the reasons the comprehensive plan should be changed if he wishes to proceed with the zoning request art i  4 1131998 fees every application 1131998   11172009 secs 1187011895  reserved division 3  board of adjustment footnotes  4  cross reference boards committees and commissions  2201 et seq state law reference board of adjustment vtca local government organization the board of adjustment shall be composed of five members and four alternate members appointments to the board of adjustment shall be for staggered terms of two years alternate members shall serve in the absence of one or more regular board members when required to do so by the mayor or city manager the city council may remove a member or alternate member of the board for cause as found by the city council on a written charge after a public hearing vacancies shall be filled for the unexpired term of any member or alternate member whose term becomes vacant for any cause art x  1 1131998   11172009 officers and compensation the board of adjustment shall meet and organize as soon as practicable shall elect one of its members as chair and shall have a secretary the members of the board and the secretary shall receive such compensation as may be determined and fixed by the city council art x  21 1131998   11172009 procedures a adopting procedural rules the board of adjustment by majority vote shall adopt such procedural rules as are necessary to execute its duties b quorum all cases before the board of adjustment must be heard by at least four members c calling meetings meetings of the board shall be held at the call of the chair and at such other times as the board may determine such chair or in the chair absence the acting chair shall administer oaths and compel attendance of witnesses d meetings open to the public all meetings of the board shall be open to the public e keeping of minutes the board shall keep minutes of its proceedings showing the vote of each member upon each question or if absent or failing to vote indicating such fact and shall keep records of its other official actions all of which shall be filed in the office of the board and shall be a public record art x  22 1131998 powers the board of adjustment shall have the following powers 1 decide appeals of city planners decisions the board of adjustment shall have the power to hear and decide appeals where it is alleged there is error in any order requirement decision or determination made by the city planner in the enforcement of this chapter and city rules and regulations 2 variances to chapter a findings the board of adjustment pursuant to the powers conferred upon it by state law the city ordinances and this article may grant variances and exceptions to the sections of this chapter upon finding that 1 such variance is in harmony with the intent and purpose of the comprehensive plan and this chapter  2 such variance will not substantially or permanently injure the appropriate use of adjacent property in the same district  3 such variance will not adversely affect the health safety or general welfare of the public  4 such variance will not authorize the operation of a use other than those uses specifically authorized for the district in which the property for which the variance is sought is located  5 the plight of the owner of the property for which the variance is sought is due to unique circumstances existing on the property including but not limited to the area shape or slope  and that the unique circumstances were not created by the owner of the property and are not merely financial and are not due to or the result of general conditions in the district in which the property is located  and 6 the variance is not a selfcreated hardship b variances the board of adjustment may permit in any district such modification of the requirements of the district regulations as the board may deem necessary to secure an appropriate development of a lot where adjoining such lot on two or more sides there are lots occupied by buildings which do not conform to this chapter c decision the concurring vote of at least four members of the board of adjustment shall be necessary to authorize a variance d application for variance variances to be considered by the board of adjustment may be initiated by the owner of the affected property or the owners authorized representative or any aggrieved party who files the required application and pays the appropriate fee or by any person aggrieved by a decision of an administrative officer with authority over any matter appealable to the city council or by an officer or appropriate board of the city art x  3 1131998   11172009 appeal of decisions made by city officers a appeal of city planners decision appeals to the board of adjustment may be taken by any person aggrieved or by any officer department or board of the city affected by any decision of the city planner such appeal shall be taken within a reasonable time not to exceed 90 days by filing with the city planner and with the board of adjustment a notice of appeal which shall specify the grounds thereof the city planner shall forthwith transmit to the board all of the papers constituting the record upon which the action appealed was taken b appeal stays city planner and building official action an appeal from the action of the city planner shall stay all proceedings in furtherance of such action unless the city planner certifies to the board that a stay would in his opinion cause imminent peril to life or property if the city planner shall make and file such certificate that action shall not be stayed unless by a restraining order which may be granted by the board or by a court of record upon application of the party aggrieved by the action of the city planner and after notice to the city planner c hearing the board of adjustment shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of the appeal give public notice thereof as well as due notice to the parties in interest and may authorize city staff to do such the board of adjustment shall decide such appeal within a reasonable time upon hearing of such appeal any interested party may appear in person or by an agent or attorney d powers in exercising the powers set out in this section the board of adjustment may in conformity with the provisions of state law reverse or affirm wholly or partly or may modify the order requirement decision or determination as ought to be made and to that end shall have all the powers of the city planner from whose action the appeal is taken e decision decisions of the board of adjustment shall be as follows 1 required vote a reversal by the board of any order requirement decision or determination of the city planner against the applicant and a finding in favor of the applicant by the board shall require the concurring vote of four members of the board of adjustment 2 lapse of order any reversal by the board of adjustment shall lapse after the expiration of 90 days where action by the appellant is not taken pursuant thereto within such period this subsection shall not apply when the applicant has presented to the board of adjustment a development plan which requires a length of time greater than 90 days in which event the board of adjustment may grant a greater length of time in no event however shall such time granted exceed two years art x  4 1131998 appeal to courts any person jointly or severally aggrieved by any decision of the board following conditions shall be considered when reviewing an application for zoning change 1 compatibility the specific use will be compatible with and not injurious to the use and enjoyment of other dust noise and vibration  6 lighting any lighting to be provided will be directional so as not to disturb or adversely affect neighboring properties  7 landscaping sufficient landscaping and screening to ensure harmony and compatibility with adjacent property exists or will be provided  and 8 comprehensive plan the proposed use is in accordance with the comprehensive plan art vii  7 1131998   new derives may be continued even though such use does not conform to the sections of this chapter  provided however the right to continue such nonconforming use shall be subject to the following 1 nonconforming buildings a nonconforming building or structure may be occupied as follows a repairs and alterations repairs and alterations may be made to a nonconforming building or structure provided that no structural alterations shall be made except those required by law or ordinance or those necessary for installing or enclosing required sanitary facilities such as toilets and bathrooms b enlargement unless otherwise provided a nonconforming building or structure shall not be added to or enlarged in any manner unless such additions and enlargements are made to conform to all of the requirements of the district in which such building structure is located c relocating a nonconforming structure a nonconforming building or structure shall not be moved in whole or in part unless every portion of such building or structure is made to conform to all regulations of the district in which it is to be located d reconstruction of damaged building if a nonconforming building or structure is damaged or destroyed to an extent less than 60 percent of its fair market value by fire explosion act of god or the public enemy restoration or new construction shall be permitted if destruction is greater than 60 percent of its fair market value such building or structure and its use if repaired or replaced shall conform to all regulations of the district in which it is located and it shall be treated as a new building e unoccupied nonconforming structures a nonconforming building or structure lawfully constructed may be occupied by a use for which the building or structure was designed or intended if so occupied within a period 180 days after the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter derives the use of a nonconforming building or structure lawfully constructed which becomes unoccupied after the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter derives may also be occupied by the use for which the building or structure was designed or intended if so occupied within a period of 180 days after the building or structure becomes vacant f manufactured home a manufactured home on an existing lot lawfully in place at the time of the adoption of this section may remain in use provided that it does not remain vacant for more than 180 days once a manufactured home is removed from a lot another manufactured home may be placed on the lot if placed no more than 180 days from the date of the removal of the original manufactured home provided it meets the applicable requirements of the underlying zoning district 2 nonconforming use of building the nonconforming use of a building or structure may be continued as follows a changing use of nonconforming structure the nonconforming use of a building or structure may be changed to a use of the same or more restrictive classification where the nonconforming use of a building or structure is changed to a use of a more restrictive classification it shall not thereafter be changed to a use of less restrictive classification b changing or expanding nonconforming use a nonconforming use of a conforming building or structure shall not be extended or expanded into any other portion of such conforming building or structure nor changed except to a conforming use if such nonconforming use or portion thereof is voluntarily discontinued or changed to a conforming use any future use of such building structure or portion thereof shall be in conformity with the regulations of the district in which such building or structure is located 3 nonconforming use of lands the nonconforming use of land existing at the time of the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter derives may continue as follows a expansion of nonconforming use of land a nonconforming use of land shall not be expanded or extended b discontinuance of nonconforming use of land if a nonconforming use of land or any portion thereof is voluntarily discontinued for a period of 180 days any future use of such land or portion thereof shall be in conformity with the regulations of the district in which such land or portion thereof is located 4 singlefamily residential any legal nonconforming singlefamily residential structure damaged or destroyed by fire explosion act of god or the public enemy or is the subject of a cityapproved housing rehabilitation or reconstruction program may be district r3 twofamily district r4 multifamily district b1 local business district b2 general business district b3 central business district i1 light industrial district i2 heavy industrial district md
